name: Juggernaut
text:
Juggernaut attacks each turn if able.
Juggernaut can't be blocked by Walls.

editions.flavor: We had taken refuge in a small cave, thinking the entrance was too narrow for it to follow. To our horror, its gigantic head smashed into the mountainside, ripping itself a new entrance.

We had taken refuge in a small cave, thinking the entrance was too narrow for it to follow. To our horror, its gigantic head smashed into the mountainside, ripping itself a new entrance.
Many a besieged city has surrendered upon hearing the distinctive rumble of the juggernaut.
The goblins built it far larger than the cave opening, but to their glee, it smashed into the mountainside, ripping itself a new exit.
We had taken refuge in a small cave, thinking the entrance was too narrow for it to follow. To our horror, its gigantic head smashed into the mountainside, ripping itself a new entrance.
Built with neither a way to steer nor a way to stop, the juggernauts were simply aimed at an enemy's best defenses and told to charge.
The mighty city of An Karras, with its rich history, built over thousands of years, fell in three hours.

name: Loxodon Mystic
text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

editions.flavor: As the nim storm across the plains, a lone priest stands in their path. At his silent gesture, the battle line breaks, and the tide turns.
Elder mystics take their vow of silence so seriously that they impose it on any who enter their presence.

name: Machinate
text: Look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of artifacts you control. Put one of those cards into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

editions.flavor: As long as there are questions to be asked, the vedalken will ask them.

name: Magnetic Flux
text: Artifact creatures you control gain flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor: After the researcher's astonishing success, his assistants spent six hours finding a way to return the specimens safely to the ground.

name: Memnarch
text:

{3}{U}: Gain control of target artifact. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

Whenever Mephitic Ooze deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature. The creature can't be regenerated.

name: Pteron Ghost
text:
Flying
Sacrifice Pteron Ghost: Regenerate target artifact.

editions.flavor: Defending to the death isn't always enough.

name: Pulse of the Dross
text: Target player reveals three cards from his or her hand and you choose one of them. That player discards that card. Then if that player has more cards in hand than you, return Pulse of the Dross to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Before tyrants or torturers, there was evil.

name: Pulse of the Fields
text: You gain 4 life. Then if an opponent has more life than you, return Pulse of the Fields to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Before religion or civilization, there was order.

name: Pulse of the Forge
text: Pulse of the Forge deals 4 damage to target player. Then if that player has more life than you, return Pulse of the Forge to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Before wars or weapons, there was anger.

name: Pulse of the Grid
text: Draw two cards, then discard a card. Then if an opponent has more cards in hand than you, return Pulse of the Grid to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Before labs or lectures, there was insight.

name: Pulse of the Tangle
text: Put a 3/3 green Beast creature token onto the battlefield. Then if an opponent controls more creatures than you, return Pulse of the Tangle to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Before predators or prey, there was life.

name: Purge
text: Destroy target artifact creature or black creature. It can't be regenerated.

editions.flavor: For the first and last time, the horrific creature experienced terror.

name: Quicksilver Behemoth
text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
When Quicksilver Behemoth attacks or blocks, return it to its owner's hand at end of combat. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)

name: Razor Golem
text:
Affinity for Plains (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each Plains you control.)
Vigilance

editions.flavor: The longer it stands among the deadly blades of the Razor Fields, the more it adopts their harsh exterior.

name: Reap and Sow
text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target land.
• Search your library for a land card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.
Entwine {1}{G} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

name: Rebuking Ceremony
text: Put two target artifacts on top of their owners' libraries.

editions.flavor: From the Radix at the hub of the Tangle all the way out to the Edges of Forgetting, a Viridian elf's life is built around the temporary.

name: Reshape
text:
As an additional cost to cast Reshape, sacrifice an artifact.
Search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost X or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor:
"Today's paperweight, tomorrow's leveler."
—Bruenna, Neurok leader

name: Retract
text: Return all artifacts you control to their owner's hand.

editions.flavor:
"Secrets are meant to remain secret."
—Memnarch

name: Ritual of Restoration
text: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: Leonin raising ceremonies take place at the white sun's dawn, the rebirth of artifacts mirroring the birth of a new day.

name: Roaring Slagwurm
text: Whenever Roaring Slagwurm attacks, tap all artifacts.

editions.flavor: Wurms compete for nesting grounds near the Radix. The young who hatch closest have the best chance for survival.

name: Savage Beating
text:
Cast Savage Beating only during your turn and only during combat.
Choose one —
• Creatures you control gain double strike until end of turn.
• Untap all creatures you control. After this phase, there is an additional combat phase.
Entwine {1}{R} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

name: Scavenging Scarab
text: Scavenging Scarab can't block.

editions.flavor: The beetles feed not on the flesh of corpses but on the metal, grinding out the iron and steel to add to their own bulky shells.

name: Screams from Within
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1.
When enchanted creature dies, return Screams from Within from your graveyard to the battlefield.

editions.flavor: There's no escaping an enemy that lives inside your head.

name: Scrounge
text: Target opponent chooses an artifact card in his or her graveyard. Put that card onto the battlefield under your control.

editions.flavor: When leonin settlers abandon their homes to the nim, items of value are often left behind.

name: Second Sight
text:
Choose one —
• Look at the top five cards of target opponent's library, then put them back in any order.
• Look at the top five cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
Entwine {U} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

name: Serum Powder
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
Any time you could mulligan and Serum Powder is in your hand, you may exile all the cards from your hand, then draw that many cards. (You can do this in addition to taking mulligans.)

name: Shield of Kaldra
Shriveling Rot
text:
Choose one —
• Until end of turn, whenever a creature is dealt damage, destroy it.
• Until end of turn, whenever a creature dies, that creature's controller loses life equal to its toughness.
Entwine {2}{B} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

name: Shunt
text: Change the target of target spell with a single target.

editions.flavor: "You might want to work on your aim."
Aranghil held her fury in her heart, hard and bright as a ruby. With its razor edge, she rewrote the laws of battle.

name: Skullclamp

editions.flavor: The mind is a beautiful bounty encased in an annoying bone container.
The mind is a beautiful bounty encased in an annoying bone container.
The mind is a beautiful bounty encased in an annoying bone container.
The mind is a beautiful bounty encased in an annoying bone container.

name: Slobad, Goblin Tinkerer
text: Sacrifice an artifact: Target artifact gains indestructible until end of turn. (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it. A creature with indestructible can't be destroyed by damage.)

editions.flavor:
"I used to joke that he had been exiled for being too smart. Now I know why he never laughed."
—Glissa Sunseeker

name: Soulscour
text: Destroy all nonartifact permanents.

editions.flavor:
"I have seen the end of times, a future in which all our kind are torn from this world."
—Ushanti, leonin shaman

name: Spawning Pit
text:
Sacrifice a creature: Put a charge counter on Spawning Pit.
{1}, Remove two charge counters from Spawning Pit: Put a 2/2 colorless Spawn artifact creature token onto the battlefield.

name: Specter's Shroud
text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0.
Whenever equipped creature deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

name: Spellbinder
Spincrusher
text:
Whenever Spincrusher blocks, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spincrusher: Spincrusher can't be blocked this turn.

editions.flavor: It rolls with the punches.

name: Spire Golem
text:
Affinity for Islands (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each Island you control.)
Flying

editions.flavor: The longer it soars above the shimmering swirls of the Quicksilver Sea, the more it adopts their unpredictability.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Jace vs. Chandra
editions.flavor: The longer it soars above the shimmering swirls of the Quicksilver Sea, the more it adopts their unpredictability.
The longer it soars above the shimmering swirls of the Quicksilver Sea, the more it adopts their unpredictability.

name: Stand Together
text: Put two +1/+1 counters on target creature and two +1/+1 counters on another target creature.

editions.flavor: Strange times make for strange allies.

name: Steelshaper Apprentice
text: {W}, {T}, Return Steelshaper Apprentice to its owner's hand: Search your library for an Equipment card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: Theirs is a craft brought about by necessity, now raised to the level of art.

name: Stir the Pride
text:
Choose one —
• Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.
• Until end of turn, creatures you control gain "Whenever this creature deals damage, you gain that much life."
Entwine {1}{W} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

name: Sundering Titan
text: When Sundering Titan enters the battlefield or leaves the battlefield, choose a land of each basic land type, then destroy those lands.

name: Surestrike Trident
text:
Equipped creature has first strike and "{T}, Unattach Surestrike Trident: This creature deals damage equal to its power to target player."
Equip {4} ({4}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

name: Sword of Fire and Ice
Sword of Light and Shadow
Synod Artificer
text:
{X}, {T}: Tap X target noncreature artifacts.
{X}, {T}: Untap X target noncreature artifacts.

editions.flavor: Memnarch shared a touch of his power with the vedalken in return for their service. It is a debt he intends to collect.

name: Talon of Pain
text:
Whenever a source you control other than Talon of Pain deals damage to an opponent, put a charge counter on Talon of Pain.
{X}, {T}, Remove X charge counters from Talon of Pain: Talon of Pain deals X damage to target creature or player.

name: Tangle Golem
text: Affinity for Forests (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each Forest you control.)

editions.flavor: The longer it weaves through the twisted vines of the Tangle, the more it adopts their hidden strength.

name: Tangle Spider
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

editions.flavor: They're considered good luck by the elves they don't eat.
Only rumors have ever escaped its web.

name: Tanglewalker
text: Each creature you control can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an artifact land.

editions.flavor: In bringing life to Mirrodin, Memnarch was more successful than he knew—for Mirrodin began to take on a life of its own.

name: Tears of Rage
text:
Cast Tears of Rage only during the declare attackers step.
Attacking creatures you control get +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of attacking creatures. Sacrifice those creatures at the beginning of the next end step.

name: Tel-Jilad Outrider
text: Protection from artifacts

editions.flavor: "When the levelers come again, we shall be ready for them."

name: Tel-Jilad Wolf
text: Whenever Tel-Jilad Wolf becomes blocked by an artifact creature, Tel-Jilad Wolf gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Thanks to the wolves, Tel-Jilad is the one area of Mirrodin the myr don't see often.

name: Test of Faith
text: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn. For each 1 damage prevented this way, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.

editions.flavor: Those who survive the test bear a mark of power anyone can recognize.
Those who survive the test bear a mark of power anyone can recognize.
Those who survive the test bear a mark of power anyone can recognize.

name: Thought Dissector
text: {X}, {T}: Target opponent reveals cards from the top of his or her library until an artifact card or X cards are revealed, whichever comes first. If an artifact card is revealed this way, put it onto the battlefield under your control and sacrifice Thought Dissector. Put the rest of the revealed cards into that player's graveyard.

name: Thunderstaff
text:
As long as Thunderstaff is untapped, if a creature would deal combat damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.
{2}, {T}: Attacking creatures get +1/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Jort the Thunder-Mad spent his life perfecting a way to harness the power of the heavens.

name: Trinisphere
text: As long as Trinisphere is untapped, each spell that would cost less than three mana to cast costs three mana to cast. (Additional mana in the cost may be paid with any color of mana or colorless mana. For example, a spell that would cost {1}{B} to cast costs {2}{B} to cast instead.)

editions.flavor: Designed to restrain petty thoughts, but used to repress entire empires.

name: Turn the Tables
text: All combat damage that would be dealt to you this turn is dealt to target attacking creature instead.

editions.flavor: "Your arrogance is my best weapon."

name: Unforge
text: Destroy target Equipment. If that Equipment was attached to a creature, Unforge deals 2 damage to that creature.

editions.flavor: Compared to the fire of the forge, the strength of steel is nothing.

name: Ur-Golem's Eye
text: {T}: Add {C}{C} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Ur-golems once dominated the plane. Even now, they maintain a deep connection to it.
It still stares accusingly at Memnarch, though millennia have passed since he separated the eye from its body.
It still stares accusingly at Memnarch, though millennia have passed since he separated the eye from its body.

name: Vedalken Engineer
text: {T}: Add two mana of any one color to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast artifact spells or activate abilities of artifacts.

editions.flavor: Art is unknown to the vedalken—for them, all creations must serve a purpose.
Art is unknown to the vedalken—for them, all creations must serve a purpose.

name: Vex
text: Counter target spell. That spell's controller may draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"The druids would be better off if they spent more time in the lab and less time watching trees grow."
—Pontifex, elder researcher

name: Viridian Acolyte
text: {1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: "We have no sun to guide our dead, so I tend the prismatic flames of the spirit fires that show the souls their way. When I die, I hope there is one left to guide my spirit home."

name: Viridian Zealot
text: {1}{G}, Sacrifice Viridian Zealot: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

editions.flavor: "I will fight only the way nature intended—and nature intended us to win."
"I will fight only the way nature intended—and nature intended us to win."

name: Voltaic Construct
text: {2}: Untap target artifact creature.

editions.flavor: The undead may outlast the living, but those who have never lived outlast them both.

name: Vulshok Morningstar
text:
Equipped creature gets +2/+2.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

name: Vulshok War Boar
text: When Vulshok War Boar enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice an artifact.

editions.flavor: It must eat its weight in metal daily, or its furnacelike belly will consume itself for lack of fuel.

name: Wand of the Elements
text:
{T}, Sacrifice an Island: Put a 2/2 blue Elemental creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
{T}, Sacrifice a Mountain: Put a 3/3 red Elemental creature token onto the battlefield.

editions.flavor: It gives legs to the earth and wings to the sky.

name: Well of Lost Dreams
text: Whenever you gain life, you may pay {X}, where X is less than or equal to the amount of life you gained. If you do, draw X cards.

editions.flavor: Some say the knowledge lost during the Ritual of Rebuking is returned through the well's waters.
Some say the knowledge lost during the Ritual of Rebuking is returned through the well's waters.

name: Whispersilk Cloak
text:
Equipped creature can't be blocked and has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Equip {2}

editions.set: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
editions.flavor: Such cloaks are in high demand both by assassins and by those who fear them.
Such cloaks are in high demand both by assassins and by those who fear them.
Such cloaks are in high demand both by assassins and by those who fear them.

name: Wirefly Hive
text: {3}, {T}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, put a 2/2 colorless Insect artifact creature token with flying named Wirefly onto the battlefield. If you lose the flip, destroy all permanents named Wirefly.

editions.flavor:
"The lifespan of a wirefly can be precisely described as ‘short.'"
—Bruenna, Neurok leader

name: Wurm's Tooth
text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: A wurm knows nothing of deception. If it opens its mouth, it plans to eat you.
A wurm knows nothing of deception. If it opens its mouth, it plans to eat you.

"The great wurm bit down on me. Instead of being crunched bloody, I slid into the space where its tooth was missing. One tooth—a boon most potent, indeed."
—The Tall Tales of Oleander
A wurm knows nothing of deception. If it opens its mouth, it plans to eat you.
A wurm knows nothing of deception. If it opens its mouth, it plans to eat you.
Jevna Nor lugged it around, bragging of his triumph over the wurm. Luckily, the tavern regulars didn't notice it was only a baby tooth.
A wurm knows nothing of deception. If it opens its mouth, it plans to eat you.
